programmes.show_description: Two decades after She's So Unusual made her an icon, capture an intimate night with singer Cyndi Lauper at New York's Town Hall from 2004.
Success: The success of their forerunners enables the likes of Shania Twain, Macy Gray and Sarah McLachlan - and later Taylor Swift and Billie Eilish - to break new ground. (4 of 4)
Part two of the definitive critical review of the music of one of history's most influential rock bands, Led Zeppelin, on stage, on record and on film. (2 of 4)

programmes.show_name: Inside Art Special: Coventry City Of Culture
programmes.show_description: Presenter Kate Bryan visits Coventry to discover the exciting events happening in honour of its UK City of Culture.
OperaGlass Works reinvents La Traviata as a film with a diverse cast, stunning dancers and a fresh, lively take on the classic opera.
The Dirty Detail: Vietnam veteran Fred Pearson is a broken man after years of punishment from his sergeant. But years later, he gets his chance for revenge. (S7, ep 1)
The Best Chess Player In The World: To prove he is a gifted chess player, a man explains how he planned the perfect murder after discovering his wife was unfaithful. (S7, ep 2)
Proxy: Three men are being blackmailed by a woman for money. One day she is found murdered and the three worry that they will be suspected. Her chauffeur, however, has a plan. (S7, ep 3)
Have a Nice Death: A successful writer is being hounded by the feminist movement over his books. If only he was at home with his wife everything would be all right. Wouldn't it? (S7, ep 4)
Number Eight: A driver picks up a hitchhiker before hearing on the radio that a serial killer is on the loose. Is the man sitting next to him in the passenger seat the killer? (S7, ep 5)
Three Wives Too Many: One of a bigamist's four wives takes it upon herself to track down and kill the other three women. (S2, ep 12)
The Magic Shop: After a little boy vanishes in a magic shop, he comes back later with supernatural powers and evil intentions. (S2, ep 13)
Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson travel to Washington DC in order to prevent a secret document from falling into enemy hands. Classic mystery with Basil Rathbone and Nigel Bruce. (1943)
A servant in the house of Wuthering Heights tells a traveller the unfortunate tale of lovers Cathy and Heathcliff. (1939)
New. Dover Castle: A host of artists try their luck as Wildcards, hoping to impress judges Kathleen Soriano, Tai Shan Schierenberg and Eva Langret. (S11, ep 6)
How has the woman nicknamed the 'Sound Witch' managed to transcend eras and trends, remaining as modern and fascinating as ever? What accounts for her timeless genius? Documentary.
David Bowie performs tracks spanning his 30-plus years in the business at Point Theatre in Dublin in 2003 as part of a worldwide tour in support of his Reality album.
Intimate glimpse of Elvis Presley's whirlwind romance with June Juanico during the '56 summer, narrated by June herself.
It was a classic tale of boy meets girl, but in this case, the boy was the most famous star in the world.
Uncover Elvis Presley's journey from Tupelo's poverty to worldwide fame.
Behind the gates of Graceland, Elvis Presley faced battles on several fronts that threatened his career, his love and even his life. With strong language.
Disraeli Gears: Cream's Eric Clapton, Ginger Baker and Jack Bruce discuss the making of Disraeli Gears, their timeless 1967 album that solidified their status as a 'super group'. (S1, ep 2)
Eric Clapton, Mick Taylor and Slash are among guitar stars paying tribute to Jimi Hendrix's magnificent talent and showmanship, as well as his extraordinary legacy.

programmes.show_name: David Gray: White Ladder - From Then 'Til Now
programmes.show_description: Celebrate the multi-platinum-selling album from David Gray, as he details the stories behind some of the songs and the most memorable shows.
Elvis Presley: Film revealing how the King created his seminal debut album. Sam Phillips, Keith Richards and BB King are among those discussing the album and its far-reaching influence.

programmes.show_name: Jonas Kaufman at Arena Di Verona
programmes.show_description: Experience the unforgettable spectacle as Jonas Kaufmann graces the stage once again, performing opera masterpieces at the iconic Arena di Verona.
The Last Of The Midnight Gardeners: An adulterous magazine editor launches a competition for a story involving the perfect murder. But life soon mirrors art. (S7, ep 6)
The Gift Of Beauty: After killing her husband to be with her young lover, an insecure woman is drawn in by a flyer for an anti-ageing process known as the Gift of Beauty. (S7, ep 7)
Wet Saturday: George Princey has a high standing in the community. So when his daughter kills a man, George endeavours to cover it up to avoid facing a scandal. (S7, ep 8)
Sauce For The Goose: Having arranged the death of her very wealthy husband in order to be with her lover Stephen, Olivia becomes increasingly annoyed by his lack of appreciation. (S7, ep 9)
Bird Of Prey: Jack and Edna's pet parrot dies after laying an unusually large egg. On hatching, it reveals an aggressive black-feathered bird, spelling immediate trouble. (S7, ep 10)
Beyond the Sea of Death: An heiress finds a man who loves her for herself instead of her money. After he dies tragically, she tries to regain contact with him via a mystic. (S2, ep 14)
New. Dover Castle: A host of artists try their luck as Wildcards, hoping to impress judges Kathleen Soriano, Tai Shan Schierenberg and Eva Langret. (S11, ep 6)
The sprightly young assistant of a Hollywood screenwriter helps him over his writer's block by acting out his fantasies of possible plots.

programmes.show_name: Sam Cooke: A Legend In Concert
programmes.show_description: Documentary exploring the career and life story of Sam Cooke through first-person accounts from family, childhood friends and the soul superstar himself.

programmes.show_name: The Phantom Of The Opera At The Royal Albert Hall
programmes.show_description: Ramin Karimloo and Sierra Boggess star in this special 25th anniversary performance of Andrew Lloyd Webber's hit musical at London's Royal Albert Hall.
Ten years after a Paris fire left only a mask, The Phantom's love for Christine endures in Coney Island. She arrives with Raoul and their son to perform, unaware of what awaits.
Michael is determined to reform and stay faithful to his fiancée. However, his attempt at fidelity is jeopardised when numerous attractive women become smitten with him.
A look back at some of the greatest past performances at the Opry to commemorate the 100th birthday of the Grand Ole Opry.
